oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Dissertation analyses the teaching implementation carried out by the author in the IES El Portillo, in Zaragoza, which is based on learning from experience by means of commenting and working on inequalities between females and males from the perspective of the Feminist Pedagogy. Apart from the personal interest of the author in this topic, the present project is the response to a classical methodology which uses teaching materials promoting inequalities. Therefore, the feminist implementation offers a wide variety of materials in order to allow students to express and communicate by themselves taking into account the genuine social challenge such as is sexist or chauvinist system. The key objective of this pedadogy resides in fostering critical thinking of pupils through the reflection of experiential facts.

Learning from experience. Feminist pedagogy as motivational methodology in the classroom.
